fields: SARS stands for
severe acute respiratory syndrome
SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome) - NHS. Retrieved March 17, 2020, from https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/sars/
Complete name of the virus causing the COVID-19 / the Coronavirus disease
SARS-CoV-2

Gobalenya AE, Baker SC, Baric RS, et al. (March 2020). "The species Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus: classifying 2019-nCoV and naming it SARS-CoV-2". Nature Microbiology: 1–9. doi:10.1038/s41564-020-0695-z. PMID 32123347.
The three common symptoms of COVID-19
fever, dry cough, fatigue, shortness of breath

pneumonia and organ failures

0-14 days

when washing with soap and water isn't possible

infection (with viruses or bacteria)

very uncommon (<5% of cases)

around 0.1%

By donating plasma (which contains antibodies)

ineffective

No evidence so far

Case fatality rate
proportion of deaths in the diagnosed population
Case fatality rate - Wikiwand. Retrieved March 16, 2020, from https://www.wikiwand.com/en/Case_fatality_rate
Why is it hard to estimate the case fatality rate (CFR) for COVID-19?

- official numbers do not reflect reality
- no mortality data available for ongoing cases

first (0-10 years)

Aerosol
Suspension of fine solid particles or liquid droplets in a gas, such as air.

at least 3 hours

How many coronaviruses are known to cause disease in humans?
Coronaviruses | NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases. Retrieved March 18, 2020, from https://www.niaid.nih.gov/diseases-conditions/coronaviruses
Classification of viruses according to their genetic material
DNA and RNA viruses

Lodish H, Berk A, Zipursky SL, et al. Molecular Cell Biology. 4th 
edition. New York: W. H. Freeman; 2000.  Section 6.3, Viruses: 
Structure, Function, and Uses. Available from: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK21523/
According to its genetic material, SARS-CoV-2 is classified as
An RNA virus
Masters, P. S. The molecular biology of coronaviruses. Advances in Virus Research 66, 193–292 (2006)
How does the size of the genetic material in coronaviruses compare to other RNA viruses?
Coronaviruses have the largest genomes of all RNA viruses
Masters, P. S. The molecular biology of coronaviruses. Advances in Virus Research 66, 193–292 (2006)
Coronaviruses get their name from

the solar corona

RNA viruses usually have higher mutation rates

SARS-CoV

Transmission rates seem to decrease when temperature and humidity are higher.

Men

cardiovascular disease

14 days

Very likely yes

Why is it that official numbers do not reflect the current reality of COVID-19?

- lack of sufficient testing equipment
- time lag between infection and diagnosis
- asymptomatic infections
